summary: Website project for uploading Python notes and teaching Python, with professional frontend + backend, a footer showing the owner's contact details, and support for adding notes as PDFs.
architectural_notes: Email functionality scope: display contact email only; do not implement outbound email sending (newsletters/verification/notifications).

existing_features.title: Create a complete, professional website for uploading Python notes and teaching Python, including both frontend UI and backend canister functionality.
Implement a notes upload workflow that supports adding Python notes as text/markdown content (no email sending, no external services), including create, list, view, and delete operations.

Add a site-wide footer that displays the owner contact details exactly as provided: Name: "Kumar Anubhava", Mobile: "9993225367", Instagram: "k.anubhavv", Email: "anubhavk939@gmail.com" (display only; do not send emails).
Choose a site name/branding for the Python notes + teaching website and apply it consistently across the header, page title, and any prominent hero/landing area.

Create a coherent, professional visual theme (colors, typography, spacing, layout) appropriate for a Python learning + notes platform and apply it consistently across the app (avoid blue & purple as primary brand colors).
Add a public “Learn Python” section/page that contains structured beginner-friendly lesson content (static content managed in the frontend) and clear navigation to the notes area.
Generate and use simple brand assets as static frontend images (no backend image serving): a logo and a hero/landing illustration consistent with the chosen theme.

Update the notes upload UI to include an option to add a PDF note: allow selecting a local .pdf file, validate it, and upload it to the backend, while keeping the existing markdown/text upload option.

Update the notes list and note detail pages to handle PDF notes: in the list, indicate which notes are PDFs; in the detail view, provide an in-browser PDF viewer (or embedded preview) and a download option.

Add/extend React Query hooks and frontend typing/bindings to support uploading and fetching PDF note content from the canister, and ensure caches are invalidated consistently with existing note operations.

new_feature_requests.summary: Build a professional website for uploading Python notes and teaching Python (full frontend + backend).
Display footer contact details: Kumar Anubhava, phone 9993225367, Insta k.anubhavv, email anubhavk939@gmail.com (display only; no sending emails).
Decide and apply a site name/branding for the Python notes + teaching website.
Add an option to upload/add PDF notes (PDF notes support in the notes workflow).

Extend the backend note model and APIs to support two note types: (1) existing text/markdown notes and (2) PDF notes stored as binary data, while preserving existing capabilities (create, list, view, delete) for text notes.
Add conditional state migration for existing deployed canister state so that previously stored text notes remain accessible after introducing PDF note support.
